subject: [DoNotMerge] Change Ceph CSI plugin to use HostToContainer propagation
messages: [{'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2021-03-18 22:45:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2021-03-24 18:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nNo longer pursuing this.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 22:45:01.000000000', 'message': '[DoNotMerge] Change Ceph CSI plugin to use HostToContainer propagation

This patch modifies the Ceph CSI plugin daemonset to use HostToContainer
mount propagation instead of Bidirectional mount propagation, which is
considered to be dangerous, per the Kubernetes documentation. This PS
will help identify whether or not the CSI Driver will work properly when
HostToContainer propagation is in use.

Please do not merge this patch, as it is experimental.

Change-Id: I937e26cb8ea65ef8fea062bac71926348584e06e
'}]
commit_message:
[DoNotMerge] Change Ceph CSI plugin to use HostToContainer propagation

This patch modifies the Ceph CSI plugin daemonset to use HostToContainer
mount propagation instead of Bidirectional mount propagation, which is
considered to be dangerous, per the Kubernetes documentation. This PS
will help identify whether or not the CSI Driver will work properly when
HostToContainer propagation is in use.

Please do not merge this patch, as it is experimental.

Change-Id: I937e26cb8ea65ef8fea062bac71926348584e06e

commit_message:
Fix automatic quota sync for migrating volumes

When using the automatic quota refresh via `until_refresh` and `max_age`
configuration options the calculated quota usage by the refresh will not
be correct if there are volumes that are migrating, since source and
destination volumes are counted in the refresh.

Normal quota usage calculation does not work like this, it only counts
it once, and so should the automatic quota calculation.

This patch fixes this by adding a filter to the query that skips
migration destination volumes.

It also updatest the DB implementation of volume_data_get_for_project
that didn't match the signature in cinder.db.api

Closes-Bug: #1917450
Change-Id: Ifff092917abe07726367a953f5ed420626c53bb9

commit_message:
Properly validate AZ-profile networks

The v1 driver was accidentally skipped when the validation was added for
networks in az-profiles. Also improved testing for both.

Change-Id: Ia343d93accc0b313d979029584ab68f270421126

subject: api: Reject requests to detach a volume when the compute is down
messages:
[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-02-01 09:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-02-01 09:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/773334/1 : FAILURE in 9m 28s'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-03-24 16:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1909120'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-01 09:45:18.000000000', 'message': 'api: Reject requests to detach a volume when the compute is down

When detaching a volume from an instance Nova will currently always
attempt to make a cast RPC call before returning a successful 202
response to the caller.

The lack of checking here regarding the underlying compute can lead to
requests never being acted upon and has often confused callers when the
compute itself is down.

This change aims to correct this by having the state of the compute
hosting the instance checked in the compute API layer. When the compute
is down the initial request is now rejected with a 409 conflict to the
caller so they understand why the volume still appears attached.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_api.py
    nova/compute/api.py

NOTE(lyarwood): I5c9734ee712e4c91a3c7a37291c48932ce0b575c refactored
_detach_volume back into detach_volume during Victoria that this change
then reverted in master. As a result in stable/ussuri we only have to
add the @check_instance_host decorator to _detach_volume.
I59298788f26ca8f32bf3e38f3a52f72ff63fcc8b and

commit_message:
api: Reject requests to detach a volume when the compute is down

When detaching a volume from an instance Nova will currently always
attempt to make a cast RPC call before returning a successful 202
response to the caller.

The lack of checking here regarding the underlying compute can lead to
requests never being acted upon and has often confused callers when the
compute itself is down.

This change aims to correct this by having the state of the compute
hosting the instance checked in the compute API layer. When the compute
is down the initial request is now rejected with a 409 conflict to the
caller so they understand why the volume still appears attached.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_api.py
    nova/compute/api.py

NOTE(lyarwood): I5c9734ee712e4c91a3c7a37291c48932ce0b575c refactored
_detach_volume back into detach_volume during Victoria that this change
then reverted in master. As a result in stable/ussuri we only have to
add the @check_instance_host decorator to _detach_volume.
I59298788f26ca8f32bf3e38f3a52f72ff63fcc8b and
I147bf4d95e6d86ff1f967a8ce37260730f21d236 cause the test conflict as
neither is present in stable/ussuri.

Closes-Bug: #1909120
Change-Id: I759aa36dc00a6c0612b9755dacd9aa414c408498
(cherry picked from commit db8213af8341989354231f9b67dd983365899015)
(cherry picked from commit 602b3e046adff9fdf52eed28414f5d50056675a5)

commit_message:
Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml

The 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options are currently set by oslo configuration library.
However, in 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py' file these options cannot be
provided by a configuration file. Changing this to retrieve both options from
'conf.d/libvirt.yaml' file.

Change-Id: I1918fda471e951f42db0d302e371108b664e936c
(cherry picked from commit 085f64578f40152273138898a0dc4566d327dc8f)

subject: Add object-expirer section to object-server.conf
messages:
[{'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-03-24 09:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-24 09:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If all contents in current object-expirer.conf is migrated to object-server.conf then we should update swift::objectexpirer which is currently putting options to that old file...

That switch might be able to be implemented easily by adidng usage of swift_object_config, but a problem might be that because we are using template to generate object-server.conf using template injecting parameters using swift_object_config might break Idempotency.

I recently started working to replace current usage of templates by ini providers. Maybe we would need that one as well...
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-swift/+/782347'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-03-24 11:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> If all contents in current object-expirer.conf is migrated to object-server.conf then we should update swift::objectexpirer which is currently putting options to that old file...
> 
> That switch might be able to be implemented easily by adidng usage of swift_object_config, but a problem might be that because we are using template to generate object-server.conf using template injecting parameters using swift_object_config might break Idempotency.
> 
> I recently started working to replace current usage of templates by ini providers. Maybe we would need that one as well...
> https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-swift/+/782347

The problem with moving to a new config file is promotion and backwards compatibility. We need a way to maintain backwards compatibility until we get the new package promoted so need to have valid configs for both the new and the old config files.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-24 12:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > If all contents in current object-expirer.conf is migrated to object-server.conf then we should update swift::objectexpirer which is currently putting options to that old file...
> > 
> > That switch might be able to be implemented easily by adidng usage of swift_object_config, but a problem might be that because we are using template to generate object-server.conf using template injecting parameters using swift_object_config might break Idempotency.
> > 
> > I recently started working to replace current usage of templates by ini providers. Maybe we would need that one as well...
> > https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-swift/+/782347
> 
> The problem with moving to a new config file is promotion and backwards compatibility. We need a way to maintain backwards compatibility until we get the new package promoted so need to have valid configs for both the new and the old config files.

If I understand the change mentioned in the commit message correctly, backward incompatible change was made in RDO side because it removed  object-expirer.conf on which puppet-swift still depends.

We would be able make object-expirer run with adding that section to object-server.conf but then the process will be started without any configurations, thus I doubt how useful it is to add this now to just unblock RDO promotion.

IMO we should not merge that change in RDO side until we add proper logic to put object-expirer options in object-server.conf . Note that it seems that Ubuntu Cloud Archives Victoria still uses object-expirer.conf . This means we would need to keep both configurations until we hear clear plans from each distro to switch to object-server.conf.

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/048215afe33544209d4c5298e4b80b6a/log/logs/systemctl.txt#2489-2509'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-03-24 12:58:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Note that it seems that Ubuntu Cloud Archives Victoria still uses object-expirer.conf . This means we would need to keep both configurations until we hear clear plans from each distro to switch to object-server.conf.
> 
> https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/048215afe33544209d4c5298e4b80b6a/log/logs/systemctl.txt#2489-2509

ok, i've proposed several ways to maintain backwards compatibility in swift package, let's see the opinion from maintainers."}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-03-24 15:53:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

reverting the change in packaging until a better solution can be handled by swift maintainers https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/swift-distgit/+/32516'}]

commit_message:
Add object-expirer section to object-server.conf

Swift is moving object-expirer service to use object-server.conf config
file in [1]. This review is adding the required oject-expirer section
into this config file as required by the systemd service.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/swift-distgit/+/32374

Change-Id: I2ed6b5be63923b01e300e8bc07e716c60ab4751a

commit_message:
Proposing Wallaby RC1 for networking-bagpipe

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release,
someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch
with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 13.0.0..a7e479f
144f243 Set secure mode for mpls bridge
e61c2e8 Switch to new rolevar for run-temepst role
fbda54e Implement "modprobe" using oslo.privsep
93d660c Add privsep boilerplate for bagpipe
7b3d23b Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
5bcd744 Update master for stable/victoria
0d84826 Remove the unused coding style modules
4fa0094 Add requirements.txt to docs deps
f0c75a9 Fix the url errors

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id359573faa10509807c6f274af8a514c32573b38

commit_message:
Release Magnum 9.4.1 for stable/train

After the 9.4.0 release there has been four very
small bugfixes. For example the [1] change is
required for Cinder CSI to even work with the
default k8s version v1.15 in Train.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/magnum/+/750058

Change-Id: I2dd929725e16317749c5c9f6022967a45f13b2a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-24 14:58:45.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Ensure $OVS_SYSCONFDIR directory exists

When compiling OVN from source (OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE=True) we need to
ensure that the $OVS_SYSCONFDIR directory is created. Otherwise tee will
fail to write the system UUID to it.

Change-Id: I6b88c8a386b7d5c38ae1ac62fd848553fc3bbdf6
Closes-Bug: #1921130
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Ensure $OVS_SYSCONFDIR directory exists

When compiling OVN from source (OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE=True) we need to
ensure that the $OVS_SYSCONFDIR directory is created. Otherwise tee will
fail to write the system UUID to it.

Change-Id: I6b88c8a386b7d5c38ae1ac62fd848553fc3bbdf6
Closes-Bug: #1921130
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix a unit test error

This change fixes the following error which curently appears in unit
tests on Ubuntu Focal.

Failure/Error: let(:facts) { facts.merge! @default_facts }

TypeError:
  no implicit conversion of nil into Hash

Change-Id: I2911d57e7f07cd07da33e816e998ef3c4d8300b5

commit_message:
Use force on subsequent attempts to add instance

If for any reason the first attempt to add an instance to cluster fails,
subsequent attempts would fail with:

Error: It appears that a router instance named <name> has been
previously configured in this host. If that instance no longer exists,
use the --force option to overwrite it.

This change avoids this error by adding the --force switch on subsequent
attempts.

Closes-Bug: #1919560

Change-Id: Icb0b10d6a5e3fe902c7ea56dbcb2f04d1129cd5f

commit_message:
Create blazar-devstack-dsvm job for stable/ocata

The blazar-devstack-dsvm job was moved to in-repo configuration during
the Queens cycle. This patch creates it for the stable/ocata branch as
it is being removed from openstack-infra/project-config. The python35
variant is not added as stable/ocata doesn't support Python 3.

Change-Id: Id6b4d01c6b832b2a99b98ce54d77ed5b5159958a

The functional tests collected OVN DBs logs but didn't collect northd
logs that may be also useful for troubleshooting test errors.

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2021-03-24 09:29:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

The patch LGTM . One concern I've is we a user wants to do E-W vlan routing
 and if suppose the destination IP belongs to the West vlan network but outside of openstack
I'm not sure how it will behave.
I'm not even sure if its a correct use case.
eg. East vlan network - 10.0.0.0/24 and west vlan network - 20.0.0.0/24
and if 10.0.0.4 wants to ping 20.0.0.100 (which is outside of openstack).
I'm wondering what will happen when 20.0.0.100 sends arp for 20.0.0.1
With reside-on-redirect-chassis, the gw chassis will take care of sending arp response for 20.0.0.1

I suppose user has to disable dvr for such use cases."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-03-24 09:56:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Thanks numans for taking a look into this.

Michal, please check numans comment as well see if it's something that may affect you."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-03-24 10:21:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> 
> Thanks numans for taking a look into this.
>

It's not my use case, so I'm fine ;-)"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-24 12:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
ovn: Do not set reside-on-redirect-chassis on distributed FIP

Since [1] and [2] OVN supports DVR on VLAN networks with usage of
external-ids:ovn-chassis-mac-mappings, but reside-on-redirect-chassis
needs to be unset when distributed floating IP is enabled.

[1]: https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/1fed74cfc1a1e3b29cf86eab2e96048813019b57
[2]: https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/522911269f1422e1274cbfbe53035a3bb8f573eb

Closes-Bug: #1920976
Change-Id: I68b9a586d1d7ec75820fedcb8e51d1c49ae871ae

Thanks, I'll rebase"}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2021-03-22 13:50:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2021-03-22 14:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-23 14:58:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I prefer that someone else who is more familiar with ovn migration will approve it'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2021-03-24 09:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2
> 
> I prefer that someone else who is more familiar with ovn migration will approve it

Basically before starting the migration, we need to decrease the MTU advertised by DHCP server (dnsmasq) by Neutron DHCP agent config change. This patch looks up for nodes running dhcp agent and puts then in the host group "dhcp", so this playbook [1] is executed only on the nodes that have dhcp agent - as opposed to previously executed on nodes having neutron_api - which doesn't assure there is dhcp agent.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/tools/ovn_migration/tripleo_environment/playbooks/reduce-dhcp-renewal-time.yml#L3'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-24 12:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2
> > 
> > I prefer that someone else who is more familiar with ovn migration will approve it
> 
> Basically before starting the migration, we need to decrease the MTU advertised by DHCP server (dnsmasq) by Neutron DHCP agent config change. This patch looks up for nodes running dhcp agent and puts then in the host group "dhcp", so this playbook [1] is executed only on the nodes that have dhcp agent - as opposed to previously executed on nodes having neutron_api - which doesn't assure there is dhcp agent.
> 
> [1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/tools/ovn_migration/tripleo_environment/playbooks/reduce-dhcp-renewal-time.yml#L3

Thx'}]

commit_message:
ovn-migration: Use DHCP nodes to configure dnsmasq

Previously, the migration script used controller nodes to configure
dnsmasq when configuring new MTU. Controller nodes may not run DHCP
agents. The patch detects DHCP agents instead and uses those to
configure dnsmasq.

Change-Id: Ib468c04779af7aaf4dedf84ba885bce71078248b
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

I agree that it's currently green but it's often failing and I'm not sure it's really trapping actual issues when it fails. neutron disabled voting on this as well: https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?job_name=tripleo-ci-centos-7-content-provider&result=FAILURE

Considering that other more important jobs are skipped when this fails we might end up with false positive so I'll just abandon that.

It's also been a lot more stable since we moved to quay.io imho."}]

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-24 13:06:05.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I279c2be7c013e9b207fbffffe47d5e15651e22d0
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I279c2be7c013e9b207fbffffe47d5e15651e22d0

commit_message:
Temp remove vexxhost dns server - failing fs039

The dns server on vexxhost infra is failing as a forwarder
on fs039 ipa jobs.
This review removes this node as a custom_nameserver option
while we work to restore the dns server.

Change-Id: Ic4acff7eaf94578c57c6526a8629225f0f857aa6

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-22 11:27:32.000000000', 'message': "Introduce tox-ansible to tripleo-validations

This patch adds basic configuration for tox-ansible[1].

Tox-ansible is a plugin for tox which auto-generates tox environments
for running quality assurance tools like ansible-test or molecule. This
tool is rather tightly integrated for the official Molecule testing tool
that integrates with Ansible.

At first, it will allow us to list very quickly all the Ansible Molecule
tests for each roles with their scenario(s):

Example:

    $ tox -l
    ...
    roles-ceph-ceph-ansible-installed
    roles-ceph-default
    roles-check_kernel_version-default
    roles-check_network_gateway-default
    roles-check_rhsm_version-default
    roles-check_rhsm_version-rhsm_mismatch
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-config_OK
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-default
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-deprecated_drivers
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-deprecated_params
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-required_missing
    ...

However, we won't be able to execute them as it for now without to make
some small manual modifications in the molecule.yml file first before to
execute them. This will be covered as soon as possible in a following-patch.

[1] - https://github.com/ansible-community/tox-ansible

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia1606db814f37a11e48508139b90cdd43c083f6b
(cherry picked from commit edb1ad92101d11a0d485eb3bbb05052e3daaeb21)
(cherry picked from commit 07c1e0f9b892be3494c99ba21a614e92c8c366bc)
(cherry picked from commit b7b6b3f3c80ead9303c8ab828465a085f2580682)
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce tox-ansible to tripleo-validations

This patch adds basic configuration for tox-ansible[1].

Tox-ansible is a plugin for tox which auto-generates tox environments
for running quality assurance tools like ansible-test or molecule. This
tool is rather tightly integrated for the official Molecule testing tool
that integrates with Ansible.

At first, it will allow us to list very quickly all the Ansible Molecule
tests for each roles with their scenario(s):

Example:

    $ tox -l
    ...
    roles-ceph-ceph-ansible-installed
    roles-ceph-default
    roles-check_kernel_version-default
    roles-check_network_gateway-default
    roles-check_rhsm_version-default
    roles-check_rhsm_version-rhsm_mismatch
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-config_OK
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-default
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-deprecated_drivers
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-deprecated_params
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-required_missing
    ...

However, we won't be able to execute them as it for now without to make
some small manual modifications in the molecule.yml file first before to
execute them. This will be covered as soon as possible in a following-patch.

[1] - https://github.com/ansible-community/tox-ansible

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia1606db814f37a11e48508139b90cdd43c083f6b
(cherry picked from commit edb1ad92101d11a0d485eb3bbb05052e3daaeb21)
(cherry picked from commit 07c1e0f9b892be3494c99ba21a614e92c8c366bc)
(cherry picked from commit b7b6b3f3c80ead9303c8ab828465a085f2580682)

commit_message:
Expose callback_whitelist option to Run action

The callback_whitelist is not usable via the Run action for now.
The patch allow users to pass  a list of callbacks to whitelist
during the validation run.

Altered docstrings to include changed type spec.

Change-Id: I37eb369701ccbd1d3fd4a7601a5e626d5867381d
Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Mathieu Bultel <mat.bultel@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Introduce tox-ansible to tripleo-validations

This patch adds basic configuration for tox-ansible[1].

Tox-ansible is a plugin for tox which auto-generates tox environments
for running quality assurance tools like ansible-test or molecule. This
tool is rather tightly integrated for the official Molecule testing tool
that integrates with Ansible.

At first, it will allow us to list very quickly all the Ansible Molecule
tests for each roles with their scenario(s):

Example:

    $ tox -l
    ...
    roles-ceph-ceph-ansible-installed
    roles-ceph-default
    roles-check_kernel_version-default
    roles-check_network_gateway-default
    roles-check_rhsm_version-default
    roles-check_rhsm_version-rhsm_mismatch
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-config_OK
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-default
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-deprecated_drivers
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-deprecated_params
    roles-check_undercloud_conf-required_missing
    ...

However, we won't be able to execute them as it for now without to make
some small manual modifications in the molecule.yml file first before to
execute them. This will be covered as soon as possible in a following-patch.

[1] - https://github.com/ansible-community/tox-ansible

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia1606db814f37a11e48508139b90cdd43c083f6b
(cherry picked from commit edb1ad92101d11a0d485eb3bbb05052e3daaeb21)
(cherry picked from commit 07c1e0f9b892be3494c99ba21a614e92c8c366bc)

commit_message:
Switch to tripleo namespace grafana images

We cannot rely on quay app-sre namespace as they removed the
image and it blocked all the content provider job.

Switching to tripleo/grafana image for the same.

Closes-Bug: #1920873

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6999e683edd82ef61fba768013b12408851f6f09
(cherry picked from commit e0b0d859efb179c6868020b3fc10c2155ed96820)

commit_message:
move flake8 as a pre-commit local target

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach [1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

This patch follows the approach used in oslo.db in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.db/+/781470.

Co-Authored-By: Hervé Beraud <herveberaud.pro@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I896af8c293d84db8e14836d5c98e7fdc3e52dfc9

commit_message:
Introduce tox-ansible to validations-common

This patch adds basic configuration for tox-ansible[1].

Tox-ansible is a plugin for tox which auto-generates tox environments
for running quality assurance tools like ansible-test or molecule. This
tool is rather tightly integrated for the official Molecule testing tool
that integrates with Ansible.

At first, it will allow us to list very quickly all the Ansible Molecule
tests for each roles with their scenario(s):

Example:

    $ tox -l
    ...
    validations_common-roles-advanced_format_512e_support-default
    validations_common-roles-check_cpu-default
    validations_common-roles-check_disk_space-default
    validations_common-roles-check_latest_packages_version-default
    validations_common-roles-check_ram-default
    validations_common-roles-check_selinux_mode-default
    validations_common-roles-dns-default
    validations_common-roles-haproxy-default
    validations_common-roles-ntp-default
    validations_common-roles-service_status-default
    validations_common-roles-service_status-docker
    validations_common-roles-service_status-podman
    validations_common-roles-service_status-systemd
    validations_common-roles-validate_selinux-default
    validations_common-roles-xfs_check_ftype-default
    ...

However, we won't be able to execute them as it for now without to make
some small manual modifications in the molecule.yml file first before to
execute them. This will be covered as soon as possible in a following-patch.

[1] - https://github.com/ansible-community/tox-ansible

Change-Id: Ia876bb1634f98e378345939788280e71738d03c2
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

from source (by default that flag is False). Now the jobs compiling OVN
(master ones) should include this flag.

installed, we are telling zuul to collect it properly for the compiled

commit_message:
[OVN] Set OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE=True for ovs-master jobs

The OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE was introduced by a patch in DevStack [0]
which allows for stacking OVN using packages instead of compiling it
from source (by default that flag is False). Now the jobs compiling OVN
(master ones) should include this flag.

Also since the logs are on different paths depending on how OVN is
installed, we are telling zuul to collect it properly for the compiled
version (this inconsistency is something that perhaps we should fix in
DevStack itself).

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/763402

Change-Id: I46654762921aeec7603800005681239cdf202632
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-24 11:08:41.000000000', 'message': 'Reset global wsgi app state in unit test

Since I2bd360dcc6501feea7baf02d4510b282205fc061 there is a global state
set during the wsgi_app init making our unit test cases
non-deterministic based on the order of them. This patch makes sure
that the global state is reset for each test case.

Change-Id: Ie2ba746a7697a70fdbc6594f02257f78becfe962
Closes-Bug: #1921098
'}]
commit_message:
Reset global wsgi app state in unit test

Since I2bd360dcc6501feea7baf02d4510b282205fc061 there is a global state
set during the wsgi_app init making our unit test cases
non-deterministic based on the order of them. This patch makes sure
that the global state is reset for each test case.

Change-Id: Ie2ba746a7697a70fdbc6594f02257f78becfe962
Closes-Bug: #1921098

commit_message:
Proposing Wallaby RC1 for blazar-dashboard

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release,
someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch
with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.0.0.0rc1..f90eac9
c6db787 Change dashes to underscore in setup.cfg
99d7832 Fix lower-constraints job
6301246 Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE
0a184a0 Configure bandit security linter
33c5843 Use json.loads instead of eval for JSON parsing
3dac655 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
ccafbb5 Update master for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie73ed2e30fe6cd0b7ef11e6badba1f335703a1d4

[{'created': '2021-03-19 16:49:59.000000000', 'message': 'Enable registration of packages with principal charm

For principal - subordinate plugin type relations where the
principal Python payload imports code from packages managed by a
subordinate, upgrades can be problematic.

This change will allow a subordinate charm that have opted into the
feature to inform its principal about all implemented release -
packages combinations ahead of time. With this information in place
the principal can do the upgrade in one operation without risk of
charm relation RPC type processing at a critical moment.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charms.openstack/+/781487
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-layer-openstack/+/781624
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-interface-keystone-domain-backend/+/781658
Closes-Bug: #1806111
Change-Id: Ib3239690286dc902eb247edec96b8dca7bf5bee4
'}]
commit_message:
Enable registration of packages with principal charm

For principal - subordinate plugin type relations where the
principal Python payload imports code from packages managed by a
subordinate, upgrades can be problematic.

This change will allow a subordinate charm that have opted into the
feature to inform its principal about all implemented release -
packages combinations ahead of time. With this information in place
the principal can do the upgrade in one operation without risk of
charm relation RPC type processing at a critical moment.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charms.openstack/+/781487
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-layer-openstack/+/781624
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-interface-keystone-domain-backend/+/781658
Closes-Bug: #1806111
Change-Id: Ib3239690286dc902eb247edec96b8dca7bf5bee4

[{'created': '2021-03-24 11:57:45.000000000', 'message': 'Return an integer value for Cores and Threads

Clients like Ironic Redfish inspector expect an integer value for
Cores and Threads. We do our best to return an integer value, we also
provide a default of "1" in case none is found.

Current logic expects the number of threads and cores to be present
in the domain, but this is not necessarily the case (test case
provided). We also can return a lot of information even when the
domain is not active, so we do just that.

Story: 2008743
Task: 42100
Change-Id: Id702ca2d7c5965217f348fc0931df0b0b1e57da8

Fix following review

Change-Id: I0672534834c59e17f27cd7632a206bc8e39652c7
'}]
commit_message:
Return an integer value for Cores and Threads

Clients like Ironic Redfish inspector expect an integer value for
Cores and Threads. We do our best to return an integer value, we also
provide a default of "1" in case none is found.

Current logic expects the number of threads and cores to be present
in the domain, but this is not necessarily the case (test case
provided). We also can return a lot of information even when the
domain is not active, so we do just that.

Story: 2008743
Task: 42100
Change-Id: Id702ca2d7c5965217f348fc0931df0b0b1e57da8

Fix following review

Change-Id: I0672534834c59e17f27cd7632a206bc8e39652c7

commit_message:
Enabling 'cinder_use_multipath' if cinder multipath is enabled

Currently,'cinder_use_multipath' parameters' is disabled in glance-api.conf,
when cinder multipath is enabled.

Enabling 'cinder_use_multipath' when multipath is enabled.

Depends-On: Ic2c86e6a890b58ca7703ea3a3147c8d4ecf13953
Change-Id: I03e042b9684e6bdd8c277066776df23d2eb84ecd
(cherry picked from commit 4535e0f35630d718f5d5a25c91af629ffad95689)

(cherry picked from commit 0d88e0e20d521bf3a19bd79d49e3f5d03fa1c5c5)

commit_message:
Support pre-built deploy/rescue ISO in Redfish

This change adds support to pre-built ISO images via the new driver_info
parameters redfish_deploy_iso and redfish_rescue_iso, similarly to the
iLO hardware type.

Also removes overly eager mocking in image unit tests.

Change-Id: I1366791a6c6eb34f3a43337c4199592783765912

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I13df57a9cd786a3f685eba4b7c7f19fa384c8a5b

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8eab6e429375d6fcc7e784456dd4019eb90f4db5

'}, {'created': '2020-12-24 11:04:12.000000000', 'message': 'nova: Do not attempt to create vms pool when CEPH_REMOTE=true

Change-Id: Iaad67025a23bf29e29011c6e78662692af2b564a
'}, {'created': '2021-01-14 16:47:53.000000000', 'message': 'nova: Make configure_ceph_nova multinode compatible

This change stops configure_ceph_nova from creating the vms pool when
CEPH_REMOTE=true as this suggests that it has already been created.

This change also only fetches the cinder keyring when it is not already
present. Allowing subnodes to be pre-seeded with the required keys
before devstack is ran in multinode jobs.

Change-Id: Iaad67025a23bf29e29011c6e78662692af2b564a

commit_message:
nova: Make configure_ceph_nova multinode compatible

This change stops configure_ceph_nova from creating the vms pool when
CEPH_REMOTE=true as this suggests that it has already been created by
the controller that has CEPH_REMOTE=false set.

Change-Id: Iaad67025a23bf29e29011c6e78662692af2b564a

commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I62e23fa6f6fda4deb7ab98ac9e2e41d8adf7576b

Add missing quotes to exportfs command to protect <world> being
interpreted as file redirect

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I835c7bc315cf5c035b9e663b5591870cbdc8d736

Heat does not support rotation of auth_encryption_key
for existing deployments with heat stacks. Once this
key has been rotated exisiting stacks can't be updated
or even deleted. Let's not allow them to be changed.

commit_message:
Don't allow rotation of HeatAuthEncryptionKey

Heat does not support rotation of auth_encryption_key
for existing deployments with heat stacks. Once this
key has been rotated exisiting stacks can't be updated
or even deleted. Let's not allow them to be changed.

Change-Id: I19c1d166ca72465fd4ae3dad46de77bb095f73d4
(cherry picked from commit 5db2ab20405a3406f208e56dfec0493e93aa0029)

[{'created': '2021-02-05 07:13:01.000000000', 'message': "modify get_version to use charmhelpers get_installed_version

get_version() uses charmhelpers apt_cache to retreive the
current version of ceph package which takes longer time to
execute. This has been improved in charm-helpers PR [1] by
introducing new function get_installed_version.

This patch updates get_version() to use new charm-helpers
get_installed_version function.
ceph_user() is updated to return always 'ceph' as ceph is
not supported for versions < 1.0

Note: This patch depends on PR [1] and so need to wait until
charm-helpers PR is merged and new version of charmhelpers
is released.

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/567

Change-Id: Ibdb36cb08950344ee55fdb8b54b47b0381f72e2c

commit_message:
modify get_version to use charmhelpers get_installed_version

get_version() uses charmhelpers apt_cache to retreive the
current version of ceph package which takes longer time to
execute. This has been improved in charm-helpers PR [1] by
introducing new function get_installed_version.

This patch updates get_version() to use new charm-helpers
get_installed_version function.
ceph_user() is updated to return always 'ceph' as ceph is
not supported for versions < 1.0

Note: This patch depends on PR [1] and so need to wait until
charm-helpers PR is merged and new version of charmhelpers
is released.

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/567

Partial-Bug: #1913992
Change-Id: Ibdb36cb08950344ee55fdb8b54b47b0381f72e2c

commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I4e5610ef33675a2363e0ef2a8997b1a8e736a0da

commit_message:
prometheus: Collect metrics from rabbitmq

The rabbitmq_prometheus plugin is available in RabbitMQ 3.8.

https://www.rabbitmq.com/prometheus.html

Implements: blueprint rabbitmq-prometheus
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
Change-Id: I4d69a93a6c70db8d40626042cdbe773747b238ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-21 21:06:18.000000000', 'message': "Allow unsupported redfish set_boot_mode

Currently if the baremetal boot mode is unknown and the driver doesn't
support setting the boot mode then the error is logged and deployment
continues.

However if the BMC doesn't support getting or setting the boot mode
then setting the boot mode raises an error which results in the deploy
failing. This is the case for HPE Gen9 baremetal, which doesn't have a
'BootSourceOverrideMode' attribute in its system Boot field, and
raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation in response to setting the
boot mode.

This is raised from set_boot_mode as a RedfishError. This change
raises UnsupportedDriverExtension exception when the 'mode' attribute
is missing from the 'boot' field, allowing the deployment to continue.

Change-Id: I360ff8180be252de21f5fcd2208947087e332a39
(cherry picked from commit 9f221a7d42350f38bc502c1fd79232593cff7ab2)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow unsupported redfish set_boot_mode

Currently if the baremetal boot mode is unknown and the driver doesn't
support setting the boot mode then the error is logged and deployment
continues.

However if the BMC doesn't support getting or setting the boot mode
then setting the boot mode raises an error which results in the deploy
failing. This is the case for HPE Gen9 baremetal, which doesn't have a
'BootSourceOverrideMode' attribute in its system Boot field, and
raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation in response to setting the
boot mode.

This is raised from set_boot_mode as a RedfishError. This change
raises UnsupportedDriverExtension exception when the 'mode' attribute
is missing from the 'boot' field, allowing the deployment to continue.

Change-Id: I360ff8180be252de21f5fcd2208947087e332a39
(cherry picked from commit 9f221a7d42350f38bc502c1fd79232593cff7ab2)

[{'created': '2021-03-18 11:10:38.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2076040ea3b7f524f884d4547b927f01b44d0502
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2076040ea3b7f524f884d4547b927f01b44d0502

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Idf92f17f515f8a7da4b3edebf0fbb710a843dae2

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3343a1d50081bb00846b48782d47b066692c0e81

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I803d2d51c0ab5d19f101d49daa67c5b7863a671b

commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I668a7489b215adb89f301de65159ad442cdb7718

CI job [2].

commit_message:
Remove templates to unsupported operating systems

All templates for Gentoo, SUSE are removed. An old pre-systemd
template for debian/ubuntu is removed. And memcached.conf template
for redhat is renamed for consistency.

Change-Id: I1ac948e0244a5eb1036049bba970cfaf8cba3f8e

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iedb461075afc50e12e647a68a9e6266b4631e12b

commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: Ie493e49188488eb2fdea244975feb8643e1ab18c

commit_message:
fix incorrect vdus number using multiple aspect_id

This patch fixes an incorrect for loop which will always reads
the last aspect_id's vdus number to calculate the current aspect_id.

Closes-Bug: #1919922
Change-Id: I5458a334ee145d54c8a70d0d37a7b674d85bd25c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-02 10:31:18.000000000', 'message': 'Modify the logic of `for loop` to tosca/utils.update_nested_scaling_resources()

When instantiating multiple VDU using `OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup` type in
vnfd with SOL format, an error about not being able to find the specified
type occurred.

In current `for loop` of update_nested_scaling_resources(), only the last
data will be stored into the nested_tpl[], the other data will be lost.

This modification changed the logic of the `for loop`, it will store all
types of data configuration into nested_tpl[] according to the `aspect id`.

Closes-Bug: 1917314
Change-Id: I40eb711b7d0e8e2cf61f0210151be60febd08407

commit_message:
Fix bug only last vdu will be saved to nested_tpl

When instantiating multiple VDU using `OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup`
type in vnfd with SOL format, an error about not being able to
find the specified type occurred.

In current `for loop` of update_nested_scaling_resources(),
only the last data will be stored into the nested_tpl[],
the other data will be lost.

This modification changed the logic of the `for loop`,
it will store all types of data configuration into nested_tpl[]
according to the `aspect id`.

Closes-Bug: 1917314
Change-Id: I40eb711b7d0e8e2cf61f0210151be60febd08407

commit_message:
Switch to new rolevar for run-temepst role

Tempest replaced the below rolevar for run-tempest role
- tempest_test_blacklist is replaced by tempest_test_exclude_list
- tempest_black_regex is replaced by tempest_exclude_regex

old name are still supported for compatiblity but we recommend
to switch to new one.

Change-Id: I5bdd7001f0b509cd315d1367d75537f5689df850

commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I29daa7205fc28e2768792c24fa054257e9f66674

commit_message:
Simplify log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated, which
can simplify logging and avoid confusion with new contributions.

OpenStack no longer supports log translation and depreciated since
Pike release.

Please refer:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Co-Authored-By: Manpreet Kaur kaurmanpreet2620@gmail.com
Change-Id: Icd3977cf87feaea3d7883d260843ec4404cd17cb

commit_message:
update gentoo keywords to support gcc-10

open-iscsi and open-isns need keywording to support gcc-10, move it out
of being keyworded only for musl profiles.

remove unneeded keywords for python-exec and python-exec-conf (marked
stable)

use the full package name for the dev-lang/python-exec-conf package

Change-Id: I44eaf8c2230e9e2089a72fce46954f4336626843
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

'}, {'created': '2021-03-23 09:23:12.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Fix baremetal SSH

'}, {'created': '2021-03-23 10:46:09.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Fix baremetal SSH

'}, {'created': '2021-03-23 12:06:57.000000000', 'message': "CI: Fix IP address detection in baremetal compute test

The 'openstack server show <server> -f value -c addresses' command
previously had output like this:

    <network name>=<IP>

Now it shows a Python output like this:

    {'<network name>': ['IP']}

This broke the parsing of the command output when determining which IP
address to use to access a bare metal instance via SSH.

This change fixes the issue by querying the server's port in Neutron,
and using the fixed IP address.

Change-Id: I55b5f185fb7136d3c6fa565aa46598f21c94eb43
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Fix IP address detection in baremetal compute test

The 'openstack server show <server> -f value -c addresses' command
previously had output like this:

    <network name>=<IP>

Now it shows a Python output like this:

    {'<network name>': ['IP']}

This broke the parsing of the command output when determining which IP
address to use to access a bare metal instance via SSH.

This change fixes the issue by querying the server's port in Neutron,
and using the fixed IP address.

Change-Id: I55b5f185fb7136d3c6fa565aa46598f21c94eb43

commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: Idb4a784a1a1296168ffd024a424dbbc9f4b9c123

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I996bcc6952a80aaccf50bb8ade579ebd960f4292

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I91d4355bb94ac18a80ff215796cd403be870986a

commit_message:
Fix gate for handling of deprecated rules and image client

oslo.policy has made the changes to not modify the
rule check
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.policy/+/774112

Patrole code for handling the deprecated code needs to make
changes to work with latest oslo policy.

Also fix the image namespace clients to be admin which were
recently changed in Tempest side
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/780108

Change-Id: I93d74d71a3e085ab4f08053db83354e86f3f2d14

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I846bbaaa9590d6f8f481ee89b13253a1bb88cc34

commit_message:
Remove os_ken/app and os_ken/services/protocols/bgp/api/jsonrpc modules

The os_ken/services/protocols/bgp/api/jsonrpc.py module was using
os_ken/app and os_ken app is the only one which was using tinyrpc lib.
Modules under os_ken/app except os_ken/app/ofctl are not used in neutron
and neutron-dynamic-routing so lets drop them from the code.

With that we can also drop tinyrpc from the requirements file at all.

Task: #41912
Story: #2008648
Change-Id: Ic35d1f7ee4112bc5cf16fee3d828534ded26ce7f

commit_message:
Add "python2" filter for Neutron rootwrap

In case of Python 2.7 Kolla's virtual environment runs neutron
processes as python2. While clean up some processes have to be
killed but upstream Neutron rootwrap filters only allow
python2.7 and python3.5

Change-Id: Ic20deaa2213b7819d47b4108f3982cfabab2eb65
Closes-Bug: #1769352

[{'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-19 04:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-19 14:21:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Rico. Removing this shouldn't be necessary. Let's fix it itself. Could you provide some context as to why this is failing? The AArch64 CI jobs passed, but those are only unit tests."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-03-19 14:31:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is strange the reverted patch adds code that is not really called so I don't see how this can fail."}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2021-03-19 14:55:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> Hi Rico. Removing this shouldn't be necessary. Let's fix it itself. Could you provide some context as to why this is failing? The AArch64 CI jobs passed, but those are only unit tests.

Yeah, I'd be interested to see the full, contextual logs.  (Reverting it in full is not correct.)"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-22 18:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-22 18:17:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> Hi Rico. Removing this shouldn't be necessary. Let's fix it itself. Could you provide some context as to why this is failing? The AArch64 CI jobs passed, but those are only unit tests.

The reason I try to use this patch to testing on aarch64 is because I found following error in my aarch64 devstack patch [1] (paste version: [2])

That error is gone after I moved to focal for the job. (Got another error, but I don't think that's related)

So from this point, I think we can abandon this patch.

We can cycle back to see what exactly happen to bionic environment, but right now, I only plan to focus on focal.


[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/77b0d998c9f14e1b859467016dfb7852/log/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt#9821  
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/803786/"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-22 18:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

New error in focal [1] if anyone is interested to help:) (full log:[2])

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/803788/
[2] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/312d8e45b079460496d90f1d940c174c/log/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt#22708'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-24 07:11:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I target the Focal error with https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/782634 (added all reviewer to that patch)
and Bionic error with https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1921073

I think we're good to abandon this test patch now"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-24 07:11:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

as reson list in comments'}]

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I0541dd6507be9c7a68044d2bac7280e1e404e987

commit_message:
Add parameters for multipath connection in cinder store

Adding following 2 parameters for cinder store when multipath usage is enabled in volume connection,
 
 - cinder_enforce_multipath
 - cinder_use_multipath

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

subject: Stop pushing acceptor and donor SR to shrinking shards
messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-22 05:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-22 06:00:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is an initial version, might also take this time to have a look through the sharder code and see if we can refactor the _send_shard_ranges code out, as I'm hoping we may only need the send shards to root container now. But there seems to be a few other calls to _send_shard_ranges in the sharder, and I haven't had time to go through them yet."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-01-22 15:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

probe test failures look kind of legit maybe

how do we know if we want to review this one or https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/771913'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-25 08:45:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Yup, sorry, didn't run the other probetests after some hacking. I've gone and fixed it in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/771913 which is almost the same patch but next to the patch that make this possible.

The reason for the two is this is a version that is post collapse changes (as that makes quite a shange to the shrinking code).

Can rebase this if the other doesn't land before collapse, so will mark it WIP."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-02-18 03:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-02-18 20:01:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

makes sense in principle but obviously disturbed probe tests. 

Shall we merge some of the patches that already have +2 and conflict with this to save repeat work on those? Then get this rebased and merged. Particularly if the probe tests need fixing here, might be best to have other changes on master.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-02-19 03:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

oh yeah, happy to wait on others to land first. This just really needed a rebase and made current again.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-24 04:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-22 05:55:14.000000000', 'message': "Stop pushing acceptor and donor SR to shrinking shards

We've currently added the ability for shards that are shrinking to pull
down overlapping ranges in the shard audit. This allows the shards that
are shrinking, the donor, to pull in the acceptor node from root.

We've also now got the final step, where the container backend can
include the root acceptor when required so the root container can pass
itself as an acceptor during a shards audit when the shard needs to
shrink/collapse back into root.

With that last piece of the puzzle we can now remove the sharder code
that pushes the acceptor SR to the donor shard replicas. This not only
stops a bunch of extra requests but also gets use to full root driven
shrinking.

This patch removes said code and updates the test_shrinking sharder
probe test to use the root driven approach.

Change-Id: Ie69265e5229598e3c2634a1d4190a4c75412647a
"}, {'created': '2021-02-18 03:21:14.000000000', 'message': "Stop pushing acceptor and donor SR to shrinking shards

We've recently added the ability for shards that are shrinking to pull
down overlapping ranges in the shard audit. This allows the shards that
are shrinking, the donor, to pull in the acceptor node from root.

We've also now got the final step, where the container backend can
include the root acceptor when required so the root container can pass
itself as an acceptor during a shards audit when the shard needs to
shrink/collapse back into root.

With that last piece of the puzzle we can now remove the sharder code
that pushes the acceptor SR to the donor shard replicas. This not only
stops a bunch of extra requests but also gets us to full root driven
shrinking.

This patch removes said code and updates the test_shrinking sharder
probe test to use the root driven approach.

Change-Id: Ie69265e5229598e3c2634a1d4190a4c75412647a
"}, {'created': '2021-03-24 04:41:06.000000000', 'message': "Stop pushing acceptor and donor SR to shrinking shards

We've recently added the ability for shards that are shrinking to pull
down overlapping ranges in the shard audit. This allows the shards that
are shrinking, the donor, to pull in the acceptor node from root.

We've also now got the final step, where the container backend can
include the root acceptor when required so the root container can pass
itself as an acceptor during a shards audit when the shard needs to
shrink/collapse back into root.

With that last piece of the puzzle we can now remove the sharder code
that pushes the acceptor SR to the donor shard replicas. This not only
stops a bunch of extra requests but also gets us to full root driven
shrinking.

This patch removes said code and updates the test_shrinking sharder
probe test to use the root driven approach.

Change-Id: Ie69265e5229598e3c2634a1d4190a4c75412647a
"}]
commit_message:
Stop pushing acceptor and donor SR to shrinking shards

We've recently added the ability for shards that are shrinking to pull
down overlapping ranges in the shard audit. This allows the shards that
are shrinking, the donor, to pull in the acceptor node from root.

We've also now got the final step, where the container backend can
include the root acceptor when required so the root container can pass
itself as an acceptor during a shards audit when the shard needs to
shrink/collapse back into root.

With that last piece of the puzzle we can now remove the sharder code
that pushes the acceptor SR to the donor shard replicas. This not only
stops a bunch of extra requests but also gets us to full root driven
shrinking.

This patch removes said code and updates the test_shrinking sharder
probe test to use the root driven approach.

Change-Id: Ie69265e5229598e3c2634a1d4190a4c75412647a

commit_message:
Add TLS options to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/774120
Change-Id: I712f03bd1dc33bd61bedf9ddea1a4ccffbedd53d
(cherry picked from commit d385ca82721cf4b4c5cd087b349d48ac318b4776)

commit_message:
remove openstack/common from flake8 exclude list

openstack/common was used to kepp copied files from
oslo-incubator, we don't use oslo-incubator stuff,
so remove it.

Change-Id: Icb8a9d8a2774003f61d7439ef55a197b2bac0ff9

commit_message:
Change Ceilometer setting for FT

Ceilometer setting in Zuul needs to be changed for FT.

* Not set debug log output for Ceiloemter and Gnocchi
  so that journalctl runs successfully
Related error:
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/5abe3c88e63249d0a6ad5bd764a9d604

* Add settings to use Eventalarm
Related to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681157/

Change-Id: I6b5a0ea996e0c6fe0f70e70841b3eec5d7540ec4

commit_message:
Switch to tripleo namespace grafana images

We cannot rely on quay app-sre namespace as they removed the
image and it blocked all the content provider job.

Switching to tripleo/grafana image for the same.

Closes-Bug: #1920873

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6999e683edd82ef61fba768013b12408851f6f09
(cherry picked from commit e0b0d859efb179c6868020b3fc10c2155ed96820)

[{'created': '2020-11-05 10:55:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add explanations on safe delete

We keep seeing people concerned about data leakage and thorough deletion
of data from volumes on volume deletion [1][2], and Cinder currently
only worries about the data leakage, not the stealing of the physical
disks.

In order to clarify this for administrators and to reduce the number of
specs proposed to address this issue we are adding additional
documentation on security aspects as well as data leakage.

This patch was decided as an action from the discussion during the
Wallaby PTG [3].

commit_message:
Add explanations on safe delete

We keep seeing people concerned about data leakage and thorough deletion
of data from volumes on volume deletion [1][2], and Cinder currently
only worries about the data leakage, not the stealing of the physical
disks.

In order to clarify this for administrators and to reduce the number of
specs proposed to address this issue we are adding additional
documentation on security aspects as well as data leakage.

This patch was decided as an action from the discussion during the
Wallaby PTG [3].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758375/
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/759553/
[3]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderWallabyPTGSummary#Two_proposed_specs_on_the_same_topic_.28mutually_assured_destruction.29

Change-Id: I9f8d413cf8337e75241ad24c85692135b34a17fc
Implements: blueprint specify-data-secure-deletion

[{'created': '2021-03-16 13:51:45.000000000', 'message': 'Label temporary files created by image_utils

These files can be rather large at times, prefix
them with identifiers so that when troubleshooting
Cinder, it is possible to identify what is

Closes-Bug: #1911766
Change-Id: I660ed16a36ad9415a5de757b32a6770e27b1294c

commit_message:
Label temporary files created by image_utils

These files can be rather large at times, prefix
them with identifiers so that when troubleshooting
Cinder, it is possible to identify what is
consuming disk space.

Closes-Bug: #1911766
Change-Id: I660ed16a36ad9415a5de757b32a6770e27b1294c
(cherry picked from commit 3ce9d773aa233829d1dcbae2f9e1aebecd248305)

I forgot the original purpose of this API.
I think it is not worth to implement this API test in Tempest because this API is only for libvirt driver and qcow2. In addition, this API is designed to be called from Cinder only.

Please see https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-assisted-volume-snapshots

 This API is only ever called by Cinder, where it is used to create
 a snapshot for drivers that extend the remotefs Cinder driver.

We tried to implement this test before (maybe 3 years ago), but gave up because of this reason.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-09-10 17:49:16.000000000', 'content': "Removed Code-Review-1 by Ken'ichi Ohmichi <ken1ohmichi@gmail.com>

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1668407"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-23 22:03:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

There is no mechanism we have in OpenStack to differentiate the external and internal APIs, even this API is supposed to be used by cinder only but there is no restriction on using from users. And by adding this service client it can be useful for tempest plugins like patrole, cinder-temepst-plugins etc."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-23 22:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-23 22:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2021-03-24 01:20:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM. I think this API is exposed to not only Cinder but also users as Ghanshyam mentioned.

And, I'm a bit worried about adding volume related tests because it can cause gate failures like timeout, race etc. But if we notice these tests are blocker, we can skip ASAP."}]

commit_message:
Add client for assisted volume snapshots API.

This will invoke post and delete calls on os-assisted-volume-snapshots
endpoint.

Closes-bug: #1668407

Co-Authored-By: Ghanshyam Mann <gmann@ghanshyammann.com>

Change-Id: I81e8fd9f89ec1cb00fc0116c31f9c0559406164

This will fail due to overly restrictive regex validation:
  cinder manage hostgroup@cloud#[dead:beef::cafe]:/cinder01 abcd

This is because validation for this call checks for a valid
hostname but needs to check for any string that would be a valid
"host" in Cinder, which is not the same thing.

Closes-Bug: #1904892
Change-Id: I1349e8d3eb422f9dcd533c54f922f7ab8133b753
(cherry picked from commit 8687925ce7b0e8f707006394f762a8f0a2ee60f3)
'}]
commit_message:
API validation: Add cinder_host type to support ipv6 in manage

This will fail due to overly restrictive regex validation:
  cinder manage hostgroup@cloud#[dead:beef::cafe]:/cinder01 abcd

This is because validation for this call checks for a valid
hostname but needs to check for any string that would be a valid
"host" in Cinder, which is not the same thing.

Closes-Bug: #1904892
Change-Id: I1349e8d3eb422f9dcd533c54f922f7ab8133b753
(cherry picked from commit 8687925ce7b0e8f707006394f762a8f0a2ee60f3)

commit_message:
Update oslo.utils minimal version

Commit Ib301466bb0a1996997c63599918fa96059a927bd added the usage
of oslo_utils md5 api which was added only in release 4.7.0.
Updating the requirements to accomodate this.
In addition, changing the requirements for other dependent libraries

Change-Id: Ia86208975cdc2e4261cb6cb20547d76ddb3ec571

Users are experiencing timeout issues in certain environments, mostly
when volumes are too big (ie. multi-terabyte volumes), due to poor
network performance or upgrade issues that revolve around the SolidFire

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix clone and request timeout issues

Users are experiencing timeout issues in certain environments, mostly
when volumes are too big (ie. multi-terabyte volumes), due to poor
network performance or upgrade issues that revolve around the SolidFire
cluster. A viable solution is to make driver timeout values
configurable in cinder.conf, so users can set these timeouts
according to their needs.

This patch adds two timeout settings to the SolidFire driver
(for cloning operation and globally to all api requests), to
allow users to set the appropriate timeouts for their environment.

Closes-Bug: #1898587
Change-Id: Ie330c76a5db0ea76d4fed5a6ae7b8736dadc8591
(cherry picked from commit c607a82a992ebe63b4ae005746f2b9e8104bb3a0)
(cherry picked from commit 3b2e7d662b6cca54d13d46161560a497d4ec5bd0)
(cherry picked from commit b790e81e744755964ffa58c057c658a1b0d74581)

commit_message:
Fix volume OVO create method

When we create a volume in the DB using the OVO interface we were
missing some fields in the volume present in memory after it has been
created.

This was caused by the create method not passing the expected attributes
to the _from_db_object.

Because of this missing information we have places in the code where we
forcefully a reload of the whole Volume OVO when it shouldn't be
necessary.

This patch fixes the create method of the Volume OVO and removes an
instance of the forceful reload of the volume, reducing our DB calls.

Change-Id: Ia59cbc5a4eb279e56f07ff9f44aa40b582aea829

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary save call

In Change-ID Ic8a8ba2271d6ed672b694d3991dabd46bd9a69f4 we added:

  vref.multiattach = self._is_multiattach(volume_type)
  vref.save()

Then we remove the assignment but forgot to remove the save.
This patch removes that unnecessary save call.

Change-Id: I993444ba3b6e976d40ae7c5858b32999eb337c66

of services that we can skip the upgrade.
Example: SKIP_UPGRADE_PROJECTS="nova,neutron"

It can be set in the job configuration so grenade will skip the
upgrade for the services, this is necessary because Ironic upgrade
procedure in the multinode job doesn't want to upgrade nova.

commit_message:
Add SKIP_UPGRADE_PROJECTS

The `SKIP_UPGRADE_PROJECTS` is a variable that contains a list
of services that we can skip the upgrade.
Example: SKIP_UPGRADE_PROJECTS="nova,neutron"

It can be set in the job configuration so grenade will skip the
upgrade for the services, this is necessary because Ironic upgrade
procedure in the multinode job doesn't want to upgrade nova.

Change-Id: I516d51a8bb6896d4ab491276050a21496ed547e5
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/705030

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 15:03:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimately
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

Testing note:
This method is already covered by the unit test
TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource, which also already
tests the return value and, implicitly, its type. However, it does not
currently fail because the unit tests run with SQLite rather than MySQL.
SQLite returns an int where MySQL returns a Decimal, which does not
trigger the bug.

TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource is sufficient to
demonstrate that the patch doesn't regress SQLite. We were not able to
think of a deterministic way to write a Tempest test for this, which
would cover MySQL. Ideally we would have the ability to run the DB test
suites under MySQL and PostreSQL in addition to SQLite using oslo.db's
OpportunisticDbFixture, but the scope of that is larger than this
change.

Closes-Bug: #1918565
Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8
(cherry picked from commit 9ed17cec2d4ce0bd27e37c2877a413f5b302f4cd)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimately
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

Testing note:
This method is already covered by the unit test
TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource, which also already
tests the return value and, implicitly, its type. However, it does not
currently fail because the unit tests run with SQLite rather than MySQL.
SQLite returns an int where MySQL returns a Decimal, which does not
trigger the bug.

TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource is sufficient to
demonstrate that the patch doesn't regress SQLite. We were not able to
think of a deterministic way to write a Tempest test for this, which
would cover MySQL. Ideally we would have the ability to run the DB test
suites under MySQL and PostreSQL in addition to SQLite using oslo.db's
OpportunisticDbFixture, but the scope of that is larger than this
change.

Closes-Bug: #1918565
Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8
(cherry picked from commit 9ed17cec2d4ce0bd27e37c2877a413f5b302f4cd)

commit_message:
Elasticsearch Disable Curator in Gate & Chart Defaults

Since chart v0.1.3 SLM policies have been supported, but we still
run curator in the gate, and its manifest toggles still default to
true

commit_message:
DNM - testing proposed changes for cephfs create-share-from-snapshots patch

      - added consistent LOG.debug for major methods
      - LOG.debug for ceph_argparse.json wrapper
      - fixed rados_commands in delete_share
      - fixed up clone status checks

Change-Id: Idb36bb87e480824e0dbcffa70f7cdba3f64262c2
