just realised it should be 'samples', not 'probes'"}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-03-22 07:18:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> just realised it should be 'samples', not 'probes'

If not sure to use which word, why not respecting the original design intent？"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-22 08:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> > Patch Set 9:
> > 
> > just realised it should be 'samples', not 'probes'
> 
> If not sure to use which word, why not respecting the original design intent？

Because 'retry' was confusing in that "1 retry" would mean "no retries". Sorry for raising late.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-22 16:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

https://martinfowler.com/bliki/TwoHardThings.html'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-22 18:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-22 20:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-22 20:44:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

I've made the code more Pythonic, made edge case handling more robust, allowed to keep other states in the history and restored previous logging behaviour (might be useful to display it like before). I've also restored the original unit test adapting it only slightly for the new logic (as it was nice to update it here). I've added a bit of a twist to the new unit test (to handle more interesting cases) and made it more robust by checking when the old_status gets updated too.
Sue has done great work with the idea and the initial implementation (deque is very elegant in here)."}, {'account_id': 32304, 'date': '2021-03-23 07:45:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Looks to me like it should still have the same outcome, probably slightly more readable now.'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-03-24 01:25:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Repeated check to determine host status

The original test is adapted because the code now no longer
overwrites the same status.

Change-Id: Ic77f932f56974a66a092b15b0d211efd73b9fc9c
Implements: bp retry-check-when-host-failure
Co-Authored-By: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Initiator group contents check

Previously, the checking the contents of an existing initiator group
was configurable.  If there was a mismatch between the initiators
from the connector object and the contents of the IG, without this
check, it left the system in an undesirable state.  Now, we check
for the mismatch and throw an exception if one occurs if the
initiator_check is not configured. If initiator_check is True, the
driver recreates the initiator group and masking view and the attach
operation can proceed.

Change-Id: I5e871679817b5aacbdd9aefdc888d1d43202b411

subject: PowerMax Driver - Promotion RDF Group number fix

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Promotion RDF Group number fix

Use remote array SID when finding rdf group number
when performing retype during failover. The remote
array may potentially be unavailable at this point.

Closes-Bug: #1908922
Change-Id: Ie5645e4664b794cfea6babcaa5b483c059b21985

subject: Update cephfs drivers to use ceph-mgr client
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-23 17:33:25.000000000', 'message': "Update cephfs drivers to use ceph-mgr client

Use python rados client to talk to the ceph-mgr service.

A python rados client is created by the driver that lasts
during the driver's lifecycle.

The drivers can now work with multiple filesystem clusters.
The filesystem to be used by manila can be specified by the
driver option 'cephfs_filesystem_name'.

The removal of a share will be quicker for the manila user.
The ceph-mgr volumes module moves the share's content to
a trash folder and purges the trash's contents
(`rm -rf` of the backend CephFS subvolume/subtree) aysnchronously,
whereas the ceph_volume_client library moves the share's content
and purges the content synchronously.

Implements: bp update-cephfs-drivers

Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ramana Raja <rraja@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

DocImpact
Change-Id: I1f81db1ba7724c0784d87f9cb92bb696f6778806

Change-Id: I8f76a541cace98f55ee2871f9e7f2dcfb3048438
"}]
commit_message:
Update cephfs drivers to use ceph-mgr client

Use python rados client to talk to the ceph-mgr service.

A python rados client is created by the driver that lasts
during the driver's lifecycle.

The drivers can now work with multiple filesystem clusters.
The filesystem to be used by manila can be specified by the
driver option 'cephfs_filesystem_name'.

The removal of a share will be quicker for the manila user.
The ceph-mgr volumes module moves the share's content to
a trash folder and purges the trash's contents
(`rm -rf` of the backend CephFS subvolume/subtree) aysnchronously,
whereas the ceph_volume_client library moves the share's content
and purges the content synchronously.

Implements: bp update-cephfs-drivers

Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ramana Raja <rraja@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

DocImpact
Change-Id: I1f81db1ba7724c0784d87f9cb92bb696f6778806

Change-Id: I8f76a541cace98f55ee2871f9e7f2dcfb3048438

commit_message:
Allow plus sign in flavor ids

The flavor id is a string that allowed the minus sign but not the
plus sign. This fixes it so that plus signs can be used in flavor
ids.

Closes-Bug: #1920938

Change-Id: I1cf9f05f019e29bdda0cf64440094884edf79279

commit_message:
Fix key validation on the ceph_spec common layer

This change fixes the way the ALLOWED spec and extra keys are validated.
The common validation function now acts against the provided input
instead of _always_ looking on the SPEC keywords data structure.

In addition, according to [1], more allowed keyworkds are added here for
both OSD and rgw daemons.

Change-Id: Idd920e0d962e345bc4cce724bfcc4577d3a5e068

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-04 17:06:14.000000000', 'message': 'Change order of inheritance in TestQEMUVolumeEncrption class

Change 00eb0f1 added the volume encryption tests based on a key
manager or fixed key present. Using a key manager like Barbican fails
this test with the following error "Invalid volume: Unable to delete
encryption key for volume." Changing the order of inheritance
resolves this issue

Change-Id: Id91887bb5d75c36c9a3c6fa4ea297c20b442fd4a
'}, {'created': '2021-03-04 17:16:50.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Change order of inheritance in TestQEMUVolumeEncryption class

Also, fixed a typo TestQEMUVolumeEncr[y]ption

Change-Id: Id91887bb5d75c36c9a3c6fa4ea297c20b442fd4a

Change 00eb0f1 added the volume encryption tests based on a key

encryption key for volume." Changing the order of inheritance
resolves this issue and as a result redefining get_server_xml method

Also, fixed a typo TestQEMUVolumeEncr[y]ption

Change-Id: Id91887bb5d75c36c9a3c6fa4ea297c20b442fd4a
'}, {'created': '2021-03-16 14:24:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove manager.EncryptionScenarioTest from TestQEMUVolumeEncryption

Introduced by Iceca320e5b93f7c64318648a94e775cc5d321c06 this test class
previously inherited from both compute api base and scenario manager
test classes.

When executed against an environment with Barbican deployed this would
lead to failures to delete secrets as the clients used by both of these
inherited classes differed, resulting in an unauthorised request to
delete a secret being made that failed.

To eliminate this the use of the scenario manager base class is removed
internally and the logic required to create a volume type, encrypted
volume type and finally an encrypted volume is copied over verbatim. A
TODO is left in place to have this code refactored into a shared place
somewhere within Tempest in the future so both the API and Scenario
classes can have a unified approach to this.

Co-Authored-By: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id91887bb5d75c36c9a3c6fa4ea297c20b442fd4a

somewhere within Tempest in the future so both the API and Scenario
classes can have a unified approach to this.

commit_message:
Remove manager.EncryptionScenarioTest from TestQEMUVolumeEncryption

Introduced by Iceca320e5b93f7c64318648a94e775cc5d321c06 this test class
previously inherited from both compute api base and scenario manager
test classes.

When executed against an environment with Barbican deployed this would
lead to failures to delete secrets as the clients used by both of these
inherited classes differed, resulting in an unauthorised request to
delete a secret being made that failed.

To eliminate this the use of the scenario manager base class is removed
entirely and the logic required to create a volume type, encrypted
volume type and finally an encrypted volume is copied over verbatim. A
TODO is left in place to have this code refactored into a shared place
somewhere within Tempest in the future so both the API and Scenario
classes can have a unified approach to this.

Co-Authored-By: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id91887bb5d75c36c9a3c6fa4ea297c20b442fd4a

commit_message:
Drop lower bound testing

As discussed in ML and TC meeting, lower bound
testing is optional and its up to projects to
maintain it or drop it.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I41f876ab7363f05a0f912a65d1484b10d5613a3e

messages: [{'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2021-03-23 12:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2021-03-23 14:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2021-03-23 20:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-23 12:08:41.000000000', 'message': "Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I2486771d784b84eeccdc3a71ab53ce707d2c8f73
"}]
commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I2486771d784b84eeccdc3a71ab53ce707d2c8f73

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-23 06:29:37.000000000', 'message': "Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
(cherry picked from commit 5d5ff82bab1dfb12e6223446b1cf20db6a348f38)

commit_message:
Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
(cherry picked from commit 5d5ff82bab1dfb12e6223446b1cf20db6a348f38)
(cherry picked from commit 276b8db5afd945bfc56ccfadd25bcce1b6df9cb7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 11:05:39.000000000', 'message': 'Publish releases packages map to opt-in endpoints

Related-Bug: #1806111
Change-Id: I2df0abed25825448569581273aee4e79a6003dad
'}, {'created': '2021-03-19 12:29:22.000000000', 'message': 'Publish releases packages map to opt-in endpoints

For principal - subordinate plugin type relations where the
principal Python payload imports code from packages managed by a
subordinate, upgrades can be problematic.

This change will allow a subordinate charm that have opted into the
feature to inform its principal about all implemented release -
packages combinations ahead of time. With this information in place
the principal can do the upgrade in one operation without risk of
charm relation RPC type processing at a critical moment.

Related-Bug: #1806111
Change-Id: I2df0abed25825448569581273aee4e79a6003dad

commit_message:
Publish releases packages map to opt-in endpoints

For principal - subordinate plugin type relations where the
principal Python payload imports code from packages managed by a
subordinate, upgrades can be problematic.

This change will allow a subordinate charm that have opted into the
feature to inform its principal about all implemented release -
packages combinations ahead of time. With this information in place
the principal can do the upgrade in one operation without risk of
charm relation RPC type processing at a critical moment.

Related-Bug: #1806111
Change-Id: I2df0abed25825448569581273aee4e79a6003dad

commit_message:
core: Add all supported releases - packages map

For principal - subordinate plugin type relations where the
principal Python payload imports code from packages managed by a
subordinate, upgrades can be problematic.

This helper will allow a subordinate charm to inform its principal
about all implemented release - packages combinations ahead of time.
With this information in place the principal can do the upgrade in
one operation without risk of charm relation RPC type processing at
a critical moment.

Related-Bug: #1806111
Change-Id: I455501c1c2cdb53e62b533be95d2493bf1a5027a

commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Rocky release used python 3.5
Current target for py3 runtime in Stein is Python 3.6, so no need to
keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I5996908b79ec0daea77de5e56e4352b2cfb7947f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 08:42:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add nova az in create_test_server

In order to set nova az, now we add a config in config.py
and add some logic in function create_test_server.

Even if the default az is nova, sometimes we want to set the
value by manual setting to avoid failure of  creating vm.

Change-Id: Ida4bc74d897e3328d965b0cdb471cae82d377889
'}]
commit_message:
Add nova az in create_test_server

In order to set nova az, now we add a config in config.py
and add some logic in function create_test_server.

Even if the default az is nova, sometimes we want to set the
value by manual setting to avoid failure of  creating vm.

Change-Id: Ida4bc74d897e3328d965b0cdb471cae82d377889

commit_message:
Use stable constraint for older Tempest

stable/train|stein are supported stable and so Tempest
master version is used for their testing. But we still have
python2 jobs on their gate and they are tested with older compatible
Tempest(23.0.0). Tempest 23.0.0 is not compatible with master
constraint anymore
- I2d58d1b524764ea1d46d6ab3a382783f6a002b34

and started failing the py2 jobs with older Tempest on
stable/train|stein gate.
- https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/dellemc-poweredge-R730-R630-tempest-dsvm-ironic-idrac/2020-05-19:10:37/727906/5/logs/

To use the compatible constraint, we need to take stable constraint
for older Tempest and master constraint for master Tempest.

Closes-Bug: #1880219

Change-Id: I11123a34297d90226077b9f559297af627ac6e38

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-03 05:56:18.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Dynamically archive FK related records in archive_deleted_rows

Currently, it is possible to "partially archive" the database by
running 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' with --max_rows or by
interrupting the archive process in any way. When this happens, it is
possible to have archived a record with a foreign key relationship to a
parent record (example: 'instance_extra' table record is archived while
the 'instances' table record remains).

When an instance's records become "split" in this way, any API request
that can (1) access the deleted instance and (2) tries to access data
that should be in a child table (example: the embedded flavor for an
instance) will fail with an OrphanedObjectError and HTTP 500 to the
user. Examples of APIs that are affected by this are the tenant usage
APIs and listing of deleted instances as admin.

In the tenant usage example, the API looks at deleted instances to
calculate usage over a time period. It pulls deleted and non-deleted
instances and does instance.get_flavor() to calculate their usage. The
flavor data is expected to be present because
expecteds_attrs=['flavor'] is used to do a join with the
'instance_extra' table and populate the instance object's flavor data.
When get_flavor() is called, it tries to access the instance.flavor
attribute (which hasn't been populated because the 'instance_extra'
record is gone). That triggers a lazy-load of the flavor which loads
the instance from the database again with expected_attrs=['flavor']
again which doesn't populate instance.flavor (again) because the
'instance_extra' record is gone. Then the Instance._load_flavor code
intentionally orphans the instance record to avoid triggering
lazy-loads while it attempts to populate instance.flavor,
instance.new_flavor, and instance.old_flavor and then another lazy-load
is triggered (because instance.flavor is still not populateds) and
fails with OrphanedObjectError.

One way to solve this problem is to make it impossible for
archive_deleted_records to orphan records that are related by foreign
key relationships. The approach is to process parent tables first
(opposite of today where we process child tables first) and find all of
the tables that refer to it by foreign keys, create and collect
insert/delete statements for those child records, and then put them all
together in a single database transaction to archive all related
records "atomically". The idea is that if anything were to interrupt
the transaction (errors or other) it would roll back and keep all the
related records together. Either all or archived or none are archived.

This changes the logic of the per table archive to discover tables that
refer to the table by foreign keys and generates insert/delete query
statements to execute in the same database transaction as the table
archive itself. The extra records archived along with the table are
added to the rows_archived result. The existing code for "archiving
records if instance is deleted" also has to be removed along with this
because the new logic does the same thing dynamically and makes it
obsolete. Finally, some assertions in the unit tests needs to be
changed or removed because it was assuming certain types of archiving
failures due to foreign key constraint violations that can no longer
occur with the new dynamic logic for archiving child records.

TODO: add functional test under this change to assert the
OrphanedObjectError behavior and have this patch assert the fixed
behavior

Closes-Bug: #1837995

Change-Id: Ie653e5ec69d16ae469f1f8171fee85aea754edff

commit_message:
Dynamically archive FK related records in archive_deleted_rows

Currently, it is possible to "partially archive" the database by
running 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' with --max_rows or by
interrupting the archive process in any way. When this happens, it is
possible to have archived a record with a foreign key relationship to a
parent record (example: 'instance_extra' table record is archived while
the 'instances' table record remains).

When an instance's records become "split" in this way, any API request
that can (1) access the deleted instance and (2) tries to access data
that should be in a child table (example: the embedded flavor for an
instance) will fail with an OrphanedObjectError and HTTP 500 to the
user. Examples of APIs that are affected by this are the tenant usage
APIs and listing of deleted instances as admin.

In the tenant usage example, the API looks at deleted instances to
calculate usage over a time period. It pulls deleted and non-deleted
instances and does instance.get_flavor() to calculate their usage. The
flavor data is expected to be present because
expecteds_attrs=['flavor'] is used to do a join with the
'instance_extra' table and populate the instance object's flavor data.
When get_flavor() is called, it tries to access the instance.flavor
attribute (which hasn't been populated because the 'instance_extra'
record is gone). That triggers a lazy-load of the flavor which loads
the instance from the database again with expected_attrs=['flavor']
again which doesn't populate instance.flavor (again) because the
'instance_extra' record is gone. Then the Instance._load_flavor code
intentionally orphans the instance record to avoid triggering
lazy-loads while it attempts to populate instance.flavor,
instance.new_flavor, and instance.old_flavor. Finally, another
lazy-load is triggered (because instance.flavor is still not populated)
and fails with OrphanedObjectError.

One way to solve this problem is to make it impossible for
archive_deleted_records to orphan records that are related by foreign
key relationships. The approach is to process parent tables first
(opposite of today where we process child tables first) and find all of
the tables that refer to it by foreign keys, create and collect
insert/delete statements for those child records, and then put them all
together in a single database transaction to archive all related
records "atomically". The idea is that if anything were to interrupt
the transaction (errors or other) it would roll back and keep all the
related records together. Either all or archived or none are archived.

This changes the logic of the per table archive to discover tables that
refer to the table by foreign keys and generates insert/delete query
statements to execute in the same database transaction as the table
archive itself. The extra records archived along with the table are
added to the rows_archived result. The existing code for "archiving
records if instance is deleted" also has to be removed along with this
because the new logic does the same thing dynamically and makes it
obsolete. Finally, some assertions in the unit tests need to be changed
or removed because they were assuming certain types of archiving
failures due to foreign key constraint violations that can no longer
occur with the new dynamic logic for archiving child records.

Closes-Bug: #1837995

Change-Id: Ie653e5ec69d16ae469f1f8171fee85aea754edff

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-23 18:59:20.000000000', 'message': 'Use (or set properly) system-id generated by openvswitch (cont.)

This is a continuation of commit 1ed276c17791dba1f0b7ef4446d0efe09135553b

When setting the system-id generated by openvswitch, it is possible that
the $OVS_SYSCONFDIR is not yet created. That is expected to happen when
building OVN from source (OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE=True). In such cases,
it we just need to create that directory before setting system-id.conf.

Change-Id: I68306a50cba7dd8d47622f2dd07ec4c41c544ede
'}, {'created': '2021-03-23 19:22:46.000000000', 'message': 'Use (or set properly) system-id generated by openvswitch (cont.)

This is a continuation of commit 1ed276c17791dba1f0b7ef4446d0efe09135553b

When setting the system-id generated by openvswitch, it is possible that
the $OVS_SYSCONFDIR is not yet created. That is expected to happen when
building OVN from source (OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE=True). In such cases,
it we just need to create that directory before setting system-id.conf.

Change-Id: I68306a50cba7dd8d47622f2dd07ec4c41c544ede
'}]
commit_message:
Use (or set properly) system-id generated by openvswitch (cont.)

This is a continuation of commit 1ed276c17791dba1f0b7ef4446d0efe09135553b

When setting the system-id generated by openvswitch, it is possible that
the $OVS_SYSCONFDIR is not yet created. That is expected to happen when
building OVN from source (OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE=True). In such cases,
it we just need to create that directory before setting system-id.conf.

Change-Id: I68306a50cba7dd8d47622f2dd07ec4c41c544ede

commit_message:
Provide the rpc_response_max_timeout parameter to metadata-agent

The rpc_response_max_timeout parameter is used in comminucation over
messaging queue, thus should be available for metadata-agent which
communicate with neutron-server over messaging queue.

Change-Id: I4826edf16bbdf338af6e050b15b4ecce9f8ca6ae
Closes-Bug: #1920842

subject: Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.
messages: [{'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2021-03-23 12:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2021-03-23 13:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-23 17:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-23 12:09:39.000000000', 'message': "Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I3c217135a9318d0678addac8c59868c7e91e936e
"}]
commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I3c217135a9318d0678addac8c59868c7e91e936e

commit_message:
Create validation CLI in VF directly

This review aim to create a Validation client plugin
inside the framework instead of depending on other projects.

This will avoid to have several ways and entry points to run
Validation. It will centralized everything under validations-libs
and will cut all Openstack related dependencies to decrease the size
of the python dependencies and then be able to be install pretty
quickly and safely an a system.

Change-Id: Ic16919b0dfccc32c18180cee6e770f0ba9a5efb1
